item.title: What's new in .NET 9.0 and C# 13
item.description:
Wondering what's new in .NET 9.0?
I've picked my favorite additions to .NET, ASP.NET Core and C#!
We're going to discover some great additions to .NET, such as improvements to Spans, System.Text.Json, Base64Urls and much more!
When it comes to ASP.NET Core 9.0, did you know it completely changes how it's using OpenId Connect by default? This is a great change, and something you definitely need to understand if your application is using OAuth and OpenId Connect.
We're also going to look at changes to .NET Aspire, a great way to speed up the development process.
Last but not least, let's look at the additions to C#!
Each topic deserves its own dedicated video, we are only scratching the surface.
Let's learn all about .NET 9.0 and C# 13!
Follow me on Twitter: @fekberg https://twitter.com/fekberg
Check out my courses on Pluralsight: https://pluralsight.pxf.io/d1MRK
DISCLAIMER: This video and description contains affiliate links, which means that if you click on one of the links, I may receive a small commission.
item.author: (Filip Ekberg)

item.title: .NET Aspire for Beginners - Full Series
item.description:
Dive into the world of .NET Aspire. In this series, we will learn about .NET Aspire, an opinionated, cloud-ready stack for building distributed applications with .NET.
00:00 - What is .NET Aspire? 11:08 - Developer Workstation Setup 19:11 - Smart Defaults for your system 35:33 - Orchestration and the Dashboard 50:24 - Simplifying Communications with Service Discovery 59:35 - .NET Aspire Integrations 01:14:44 - Deploying a .NET Aspire Solution

item.title: Everything I've learned so far about running local LLMs
Build a ChapGPT App In C# with the OpenAI API! - Large Language Model Programming Tutorial
item.description:
In this video, learn how to build a simple yet powerful console application that communicates with ChatGPT to send prompts and receive AI-generated responses. Follow along as I demonstrate the code setup, explain key functions, and show how to integrate OpenAI's API into your C# application. Perfect for developers looking to add AI capabilities to their projects or those curious about building ChatGPT-driven applications. Tune in, get hands-on, and start building
#chatgpt #ai #csharp #tech
item.author: (Nick Proud)

item.title: Handling Concurrency Conflicts with Entity Framework
item.description:
Hi there! Today we are going to see how we can handle concurrency conflicts with Entity Framework, using the optimistic concurrency approach!
Chapters: 00:00 : The Problem 03:45 : What is Versioning 05:17 : Versioning (SQL Server) 06:25 : Versioning (Generic Solution)

item.title: AI at the Edge with Meadow and .NET | .NET Conf 2024
item.description:
Explore the intersection of AI and edge computing with Meadow and .NET. This talk delves into implementing TensorFlow Lite for Microcontrollers on the Meadow F7, empowering developers to run machine learning models directly on microcontrollers. We'll also examine innovative AI sensors from companies like Useful Sensors, such as the Tiny Code Reader and Person Sensor, which offer plug-and-play AI functionalities. Join us to learn how to harness these tools to create intelligent, efficient, and responsive edge devices.

item.title: An awaitable Blazor Modal Dialog
item.description: I already showcased a simple modal dialog in a previous post. However, the dialog was not awaitable. In this post, I'll show you how to create an awaitable modal dialog.

item.title: Create great MIDI 2.0 apps using Windows MIDI Services and C# | .NET Conf 2024
item.description:
The open source Windows MIDI Services project (https://aka.ms/midi) is nearing its first consumer release, and is getting ready to be in-boxed in Windows. In this session, learn about what the new MIDI stack brings, and then learn how to use the developer preview bits available today to create MIDI 2.0 and MIDI 1.0 apps for Windows, including virtual devices, USB, and more, all using C#.

item.title: Introduction to Event-Driven Architecture (EventHighway)
item.description:
In this session, I'm going to walk you through event-driven architecture as a pattern - we will explore existing implementations and available offerings in that space and then lastly I'm going to introduce you to an open-source standard-compliant .NET library that can help you implement event-driven systems especially at large scale/enterprise-level in less than 10 mins.
Here's some useful links: EventHighway Nuget Package: https://www.nuget.org/packages/EventHighway
EventHighway Source Code: https://github.com/hassanhabib/EventHighway
The Standard: https://github.com/hassanhabib/The-Standard
item.author: (Hassan Habib)
